revised_title: An Investigation of Heat Production in Different Materials
tldr: The author conducts an experiment to determine if an equal application of heat to different materials will produce the same amount of heat. He uses two identical apparatuses, one with a pasteboard diaphragm and the other with an iron diaphragm, to test the effect of the sun's rays on the materials. The results show that the iron diaphragm generates more heat than the pasteboard diaphragm, indicating that the efficiency of heat production depends on the material.
